events.title: East-West Schism
events.description: The mutual excommunications by the Pope and the Patriarch marked the formal split between the Roman Catholic and Eastern Orthodox Churches.
events.significance: This event symbolized the major division within Christianity that persists to this day.

events.title: End of the Potsdam Conference
events.description: Allied leaders Truman, Stalin, and Churchill concluded the Potsdam Conference discussing post-World War II order and European borders.
events.significance: The agreements shaped the geopolitical landscape of post-war Europe and intensified Cold War tensions.

events.title: Troubles: IRA Detonates Bomb at Guildford Pub
events.description: The Provisional IRA planted bombs in pubs in Guildford, England, killing five civilians and injuring many others.
events.significance: Marked a significant escalation in the Northern Ireland conflict known as The Troubles.

events.title: London Bombings Trial Verdict
events.description: Four men were convicted of carrying out the July 7, 2005 London bombings which killed 52 people and injured hundreds.
events.significance: A key moment in the UK's response to terrorism and public security measures.
